alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Southern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 11:08PM MST until December 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, Blowing and drifting snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Interstate 15 Corridor north of Power, Southern High Plains, Cascade County below 5000ft, and Judith Basin County and Judith Gap. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Blowing and drifting snow Wednesday may significantly reduce visibility and cause partial lane blockages. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Southern High Plains
